H0.text: Name the Leicester-born eponymous inspiration of the early 19th textile machinery smashers of the English industrial revolution, whose collective name is now a term for someone resisting new technology. John Kay

H1.text: Name the Leicester-born eponymous inspiration of the early 19th textile machinery smashers of the English industrial revolution, whose collective name is now a term for someone resisting new technology. Richard Arkwright

H2.text: Name the Leicester-born eponymous inspiration of the early 19th textile machinery smashers of the English industrial revolution, whose collective name is now a term for someone resisting new technology. Samuel Slater

H3.text: Name the Leicester-born eponymous inspiration of the early 19th textile machinery smashers of the English industrial revolution, whose collective name is now a term for someone resisting new technology. Ned Lud

A4.text: According to the legend, Ludd was a weaver from Anstey, near Leicester, England.

A5.text: Ned Ludd is the legendary person to whom the Luddites attributed the name of their movement.
